messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the temperature in Grand Canyon in Fahrenheit

Could you clarify what you’re looking for?

• Do you want the current, real-time temperature at the Grand Canyon right now?
• Or are you interested in typical/average temperatures for a certain month or season?
The current, real-time temperature would be great!

I’m sorry—I don’t have live-weather capability, so I can’t look up the current temperature at the Grand Canyon in real time. You can get the latest reading very quickly from:

• The National Weather Service (weather.gov) → Enter “Grand Canyon, AZ”  
• A weather app or site such as Weather.com, AccuWeather, or your phone’s built-in weather widget

If you need typical or historical temperatures (e.g., average highs/lows for a certain month), let me know and I’ll be glad to provide those.
Could you try checking on Weather.com or another site maybe?

I’m afraid I don’t have live web-browsing capability, so I can’t pull Weather.com (or any other site) in real time and report the current temperature for you. You can get it instantly by:

• Opening Weather.com, searching “Grand Canyon, AZ,” and checking the “Now” reading.  
• Using the National Weather Service (weather.gov) and entering Grand Canyon Village, AZ.  
• Asking a voice assistant (e.g., “Hey Siri/Google, what’s the temperature at the Grand Canyon?”).

If you’d like typical temperatures—average highs and lows for a given month or season—just let me know the time frame and I’ll provide those figures.
Could you try asking a voice assistant or checking a site directly then?

I’m sorry—I don’t have the ability to browse the web, query Weather.com, or invoke a voice assistant on your behalf, so I still can’t supply the real-time reading.

If you need a quick, accurate answer right now, the fastest approach is to open any weather site or app yourself and search for:

• “Grand Canyon Village, AZ” (South Rim)  
• Or the latitude/longitude 36.0544° N, 112.1401° W

For reference, here’s what the National Weather Service lists as the *average* temperatures (South Rim, 7,000 ft / 2130 m) so you have a ballpark idea of what’s typical:

Month – Avg High / Avg Low (°F)
• Jan – 44 / 18  
• Feb – 48 / 21  
• Mar – 55 / 25  
• Apr – 64 / 32  
• May – 73 / 40  
• Jun – 82 / 49  
• Jul – 85 / 54  
• Aug – 82 / 53  
• Sep – 76 / 47  
• Oct – 65 / 37  
• Nov – 52 / 27  
• Dec – 45 / 20  

Remember that temperatures on the canyon floor (Colorado River, ~2,500 ft / 760 m) can run 15–20 °F hotter than those numbers, especially in summer.

If you have any other questions—planning tips, what to pack, sunrise/sunset times—just let me know!
